CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 11, 1959, pg.1 reads: "As Pittsburgh Played Host to the All-Stars - Pow-wow - Ernie banks, Cubs; Johnny Temple, Redlegs, and Bill White of the St. Louis Cardinals, get together during a batting practice just before the beginning of the annual All-Star baseball game at Forbes Field, Tuesday. Banks banged out two doubles during the game. - Harris Photo."  "Twice in 1950s (the McCarthy era), the Reds, fearing that their traditional club nickname would associate them with the threat of Communism, officially changed the name of the team to the Cincinnati Redlegs. From 1956 to 1960, the club's logo was altered to remove the term "REDS" from the inside of the "wishbone C" symbol. The "REDS" reappeared on the 1961 uniforms, but the point of the C was removed, leaving a smooth, non-wishbone curve. The traditional home-uniform logo was restored in 1967."  - Wikipedia (Accessed June 2, 2009)
TitMainTitle: Baseball players, Chicago Cubs Ernie Banks, no. 16 Cincinnati Redlegs (Reds) Johnny Temple, and St. Louis Cardinals Bill White, posing with bats during All Star Game, Forbes Field
CatSubject_tab: Banks, Ernie, 1931-Baseball players--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Forbes Field (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.All-Star Baseball Game.
